summary: This document contains interview summaries from the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 31, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's behavior and interactions with his cellmate. It includes the cellmate's account of finding Epstein unresponsive in their cell and statements about Epstein's disturbing comments regarding underage girls and dissatisfaction with his attorneys.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the interviews; described as making disturbing comments about underage girls, complaining about his attorneys, and found unresponsive in his cell by his cellmate.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Another inmate mentioned by Epstein as being upset after returning from court and calling Epstein a derogatory name.

persons.name: Illippillipaimamimmna
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who was interviewed; he reported finding Epstein unresponsive in their cell and recounted Epstein's disturbing statement about the legality of age 14 in most states.

connections.description: Housed together in the Special Housing Unit; the cellmate witnessed Epstein's condition and heard his statements.
Both inmates; Epstein described an incident where Tartaglione was upset and called him a name.

events.title: Cellmate finds Epstein unresponsive
events.description: Epstein's cellmate found him sitting on the floor with his eyes open, unresponsive, and snoring, leading the cellmate to believe Epstein was having a heart attack and to bang on the door for help.

events.title: Prison interviews conducted
events.description: Interviews were conducted with inmate Illippillipaimamimmna and with Jeffrey Epstein in the Special Housing Unit and Receiving and Discharge areas of the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Incident with inmate Tartaglione
events.description: Epstein recounted an incident from two days prior where inmate Tartaglione returned from court upset and called Epstein a derogatory name.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (inferred from context of SHU and R&D)
keyFacts: Epstein's cellmate found him unresponsive, sitting on the floor with his eyes open and snoring, on the morning of July 31, 2019.
The cellmate reported that Epstein had previously stated, 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states and I don't understand what's the problem here,' which made the cellmate uncomfortable.
Epstein was reportedly pacing the cell and complaining that his attorneys were not doing their job and that he needed to fire them.
The cellmate expressed no issues being housed with Epstein but did not want to be involved in any plots Epstein might have to get released.
